meanings.definition: The state of being ineffective or futile.
meanings.sent1: Despite their efforts, the unavailingnesses of the plan became evident.
meanings.sent2: The unavailingnesses of his attempts to fix the broken toy frustrated him.
meanings.sent3: The unavailingnesses of the squirrel trying to reach the bird feeder provided some entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The unavailingnesses of the old bridge to withstand the storm highlighted its weakness.
meanings.sent5: The unavailingnesses of the flashlight in the dark forest left them feeling lost.

meanings.sent1: The unavailingnesses of her project left her disappointed.
meanings.sent2: He felt discouraged by the unavailingnesses of his job search.
meanings.sent3: The unavailingnesses of the cat trying to catch the laser pointer amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The unavailingnesses of the marathon runner to finish the race saddened his supporters.
meanings.sent5: The unavailingnesses of the student's efforts to understand the math problem frustrated him.

meanings.definition: Inability to produce the desired result.
meanings.sent1: The unavailingnesses of the machine to start caused delays in production.
meanings.sent2: She was frustrated by the unavailingnesses of her attempts to open the jar.
meanings.sent3: The unavailingnesses of the umbrella to keep him dry in the heavy rain made him laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unavailingnesses of the key to unlock the door left them stranded outside.
meanings.sent5: The unavailingnesses of the plant to grow in the dark corner puzzled the gardener.
